alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 7:34PM CST until February 07 at 2:34AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County. .Flooding continues on the Catoma Creek and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Sunday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Residential and street flooding becomes a problem...and increases rapidly above 24 feet. Several residences are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Saturday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 4.1 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
